mealPrepInfo.groceryList:
1. 1 whole wheat pie crust, fresh
2. 1 cup vegetable stock, homemade preferred
3. 2 large free-range eggs
4. 1 cup sharp cheddar cheese, freshly grated
5. 1 white onion, finely chopped
6. 2 cloves garlic, minced
7. 1 tablespoon olive oil, extra-virgin
8. 1/2 cup bell peppers, finely chopped
9. 1/2 cup mushrooms, fresh and sliced
10. 1/2 cup spinach, fresh
11. 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, freshly ground
12. 1/2 teaspoon sea salt
13. A handful of fresh basil leaves, finely chopped
14. 1 tablespoon butter, unsalted
15. 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved.
mealPrepInfo.cookingMethod:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F.
2. Roll out your whole wheat dough to fit your 9-inch pie dish.
3. Press the dough into the dish and trim the edges.
4. Dock the dough with a fork to prevent puffing.
5. Bake the crust for 10-12 minutes, or until lightly golden.
6. While the crust is baking, dice 2 medium onions and 2 cloves of garlic.
7. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
8. Add the onions and garlic to the pan and sauté until translucent.
9. Add 1 cup of sliced mushrooms to the pan and continue to sauté until mushrooms are softened.
10. Add 1/2 cup of vegetable stock to the pan and let simmer until reduced by half.
11. In a separate bowl, whisk together 4 eggs and 1/2 cup of skim milk.
12. Once the stock has reduced, stir in the egg and milk mixture.
13. Pour the mixture into the pre-baked crust.
14. Bake the quiche in the oven for 25-30 minutes, or until set and lightly browned on top.
15. Allow the quiche to cool for at least 10 minutes before slicing into 5 even portions.
16. Store the remaining portions in the refrigerator for future meals.
